Subtracting 153 from {{TA|2941|n}} yields 2788) was the chief of the [[ravens]] of [[Ravenhill]] near [[Lonely Mountain|Erebor]].{{H|15}} ==History== Roäc was the son of [[Carc]], and as such "''a descendant of those'' [ravens] ''that had remained on the hill even after Smaug had driven out their old allies, the [[Dwarves]]"''.{{webcite|author=Mark Fisher|articleurl=http://www.glyphweb.com/ARDA/r/roac.html|articlename=Roäc: The old raven of Ravenhill|dated=|website=EoA}} While [[Thorin and Company]] and [[Bilbo Baggins]] were keeping watch on Erebor, an old [[thrushes|thrush]] summoned Roäc. When he met Thorin and Company in [[Third Age]] {{TA|2941|n}}, Roäc was marked by age, being 153 years old. Being able to speak [[Westron]], the raven delivered the news that [[Smaug]] had been killed. Roäc agreed to bring a message to [[Dáin Ironfoot|Dáin II Ironfoot]] from Thorin, a call for help in guarding the treasures of Erebor in the wake of war. However, Roäc also gave a piece of advice to Thorin, warning him that "''the treasure is likely to be your death''".{{H|16}} ==Etymology== ''Roäc'' is likely an [[Wikipedia:Onomatopoeia|onomatopoeic]] name.{{HM|AH}}, p. 316 ==Inspiration== {{seealso|Ravens#Inspiration}} In [[Celtic]] (especially Irish) mythology, ravens are often associated with warfare and the battleground. In [[Welsh]] mythology, ravens figure as the army of King Arthur's knight Owain.[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raven_in_mythology#Celtic_mythology Raven in mythology: Celtic mythology] at [http://en.wikipedia.org/ Wikipedia] (accessed 4 December 2010) In ''[[The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún]]'', a raven and a finch speak five of the verses,{{HM|SG}}, pp. 116-117, 214-215 reminiscent of Roäc and the old thrush. ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| CAR | |CAR=[[Carc]]

However, just prior to the final confrontation with the [[Elves of Mirkwood|Elven]] Army assembled before the gates, a raven is seen flying away from the gate of [[Lonely Mountain|Erebor]], then just before [[Dáin Ironfoot|Dáin]]'s Army of [[Dwarves]] arrives, the raven is seen flying back to [[Thorin]] at the gate.
